client_profile: A couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels. Budget is 610000–1135000 EUR. Priorities include cafes, restaurants, and local markets.
must_have: One or more bedrooms in the apartment.
Access to local cafes and vibrant restaurants.
Proximity to markets and local shops.
red_flags: High traffic noise in busy areas.
Long commute times for remote work.
contradictions: Central areas may be noisy but vibrant.
Quieter districts could lack dining options.
Prices in popular areas can exceed budget.

top_districts.name: Ixelles

microhoods.name: Boondael
microhoods.why: Boondael offers lively cafes and transit access at Flagey.
microhoods.watch_out: Popular streets get noisy on weekends; parking is tight.

microhoods.name: Brugmann - Lepoutre
microhoods.why: Brugmann features local shops and green spaces transitioning towards quieter zones.
microhoods.watch_out: Expect traffic during rush hours; plan accordingly.

microhoods.name: Universite
microhoods.why: Universite is known for vibrant nightlife and diverse dining options.
microhoods.watch_out: Some streets may be too lively and noisy at night.

why: Rich cultural scene with local markets and cafes mixed with parks.

top_districts.name: City of Brussels

microhoods.name: Domaine Royal Laeken
microhoods.why: Domaine offers a quieter vibe while accessing major attractions easily.

microhoods.name: Haren

microhoods.name: Heembeek
